review_title: You are never just a cog in the machine at Cardinal Stritch University.
job_title: Interim Enrollment Data Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Cardinal Stritch University has an honest and caring community of employees. I use the the word community because it's one of the things that is very important to people working here. People here work for the same goal with a strong sense of compassion and care. As an employee you are not just a number or a cog in the wheel you are a part of a team that will help you when you need it and have a common goal to provide a positive experience for the students we serve. This is not only a set of ethics and goals but a way of life. The focus on work life balance is great. The compensation is great and has recently been re-aligned to be competitive.
cons: There is always room for improvement for any organization but most of the ones here are what I would consider minor. The tech could be improved or updated to make processes easier but to be honest there are plans in place to address these concerns.

pros: You can walk the entire school in 5 minutes. The mission orientation was my favorite part about training. Students and staff get free unlimited counseling (careful though, because the staff is so small, your secrets may get shared). School plays were cute.
cons:
No one has it together. For example, IT doesn't know how to replace ink in printers and doesn't have the money to buy ink. The employee computers are very old and do not hold a charge without the charger connected at all times.
People constantly talk about how the school has no money. Many use it as an excuse to not try.
Because so many systems are primitive or unorganized, things are significantly harder to do. Instead of trying to fix the systems both for students and to make staff's job easier, they do nothing.
The student athletes get away with murder here.
Bad training overall. No potential to move up here, or even get a pay raise. Benefits were okay.

pros:
-small caring and personal university where you can really get to know your colleagues and students
-great location not far from the city in a north suburb
-quality, personalized education for underprivledged students
cons:
-tough financial times; salary is not really sufficient and medical benefits are a joke for a single young person 
-difficult to advance and create change that is accepted
-still has a lot of catching up to do as an institution regarding effective university processes, technology

pros:
Student attitudes make a difference 
Friendly staff to work with 
Free parking in multiple spots
Support in my department to get things done
cons:
No cost of living increases is hard
No budget for activities or training
1% pension match do better not doing
Costly insurance with high copays
Academic reputation
Management culture

review_title: if you work in an area of the university that lives the Franciscan values it is a very good place to work
pros: daily mass is available; summer hours; mission to serve underserved is lived by many
cons: very political at the top levels and often stray from ensuring Franciscan values are core to the environment, decisions, and work; low pay; limited career tracks for most staff; poor benefits; 4 presidents in five years along with revolving door at the dean level and the VP of Academic Affairs

pros: Some of the students are very friendly and fun to interact with. Half of the people you work with are very friendly and personable, and will be fun to work with.
cons: The university has lost its way and won't be finding it any time soon. There has been a lot of set backs in the last 10 years and they haven't figured out how to bounce back from them. So that means low chance for raises, minimal raises if you get one, no room for advancement, random layoffs, random "restructuring" (which is code for positions are eliminated and everyone's work load goes up), no guidance from management, and no accountability.

pros: The students are the best part of working at this university. Opportunities to interact with them and share knowledge. Fellow faculty show support and caring.
cons: While the university prides itself on Franciscan values they seem to have lost their way over the last few years. Administration no longer looks for faculty feedback but rather is centered on being a cold place to work with little respect for those with experience or ideas that are not top down.

pros: The students and being around the caring community.  They have deep history that they value and try to uphold.  They fall short sometimes but that okay I guess
cons: no upper movement.  posistions are very stagnet and I didn't like that.  However t he community was great to be around ie students

job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Milwaukee, WI
pros: CSU is going through an incredible growth spurt and a chance that many universities never get-a comeback. President Rinehart is the first president of too many over the last 8 years whose dedication to the mission is apparent to students, faculty and administration.
cons: They need to take the time to make sure they get it right. I believe this is happening.

review_title: Great students and colleagues...disastrous leadership board.
pros: Working with the students, faculty and colleagues is the best part of Cardinal Stritch.  Watching the students grow and achieving their goals is a great reminder what we work so hard everyday.
cons: There are some really troubled people who hold upper level management and leadership roles that shouldn't be there. The university has a history of budget cuts every year that major cuts with no end in sight.

pros: The campus is beautiful and the students are wonderful to work with. The benefits are decent and general atmosphere is positive.
cons: The top down corporate style management is difficult to understand in a university setting. Most people are easy to work with but there is a large gap between where decisions are made and action is taken.

review_title: Graduate assistantship benefits can be misleading depending on program
pros: Assistantships provide up to 15 credits (6 per semester, 3 summer) annually as part of compensation.
cons: Different graduate programs have different course loads per semester and the university does not account for these differences. Stipends are also minimal and mainly cover fees that are not part of remission.

pros: The new Dean in the College of Business is moving the college forward. Stritch has been more visible on social platforms and in the media. Improved student experience and faculty development is a major focus. Great diverse leadership! Way to go Stritch!
cons: Salaries could be significantly improved.

review_title: Student interaction great! Professional growth limited
pros: Great students, amazing co-workers, and wonderful mission.
cons: Departments not able to work together smoothly. Unable to advance in career depending on department. No direction from upper management.

job_title: Director of Education in Northbrook, IL
pros: Really good environment to work, people are always helping each other, people are very friendly
cons: The lack of investment in marketing and upgrade certain areas of the company. Need to innovate in some parts

pros: Great place to work!  great benefits and a ton of time off! The education benefit is huge and is worth the job alone!
cons: The university needs to keep working on updating some of its buildings and classrooms.

review_title: Wonderful institution of higher education that provides various program options for traditional/non traditional students
job_title: Director of Admissions for Adult & Professional Studies in Milwaukee, WI
pros: People, programs, community engagement, diversity
cons: Would like to see updated athletics area in an effort for staff to utilize for ongoing wellness

pros:

Fun atmosphere

cons:

pros: The bosses are easy-going. They understand your schedule & are willing to work around it. It was a great way to offset some tuition.
cons: No benefits, besides the pay of course!

pros: many days off.  Used to feel like a family here
cons: haven't had a raise in 5 years

review_title: Do your research before working here
pros: Values based institution, some nice people
cons: Poor management at top, poor hiring and financial decisions, outside recruiters for College of Business in conflict with values of institution.
